Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
New York University Clerical Workers Organizing Campaign Records TAM 126
0.5 Linear Feet (1 box)
1969-1971 United Automobile Workers, District 65 and the Office and Professional Employees International Union, Local 153 led an unsuccessful clerical workers organizing campaign at New York University, beginning in the fall of 1969 and continuing through 1971. The collection includes printed ephemera produced by the organizing campaign and student supporters, statements and press releases by the university, picket duty material, and NLRB and SLRB documents. Materials are in English
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in repository. The accession number related to this collection is 1950.024
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.
Historical/Biographical Note
United Automobile Workers, District 65 and the Office and Professional Employees International Union, Local 153 led an unsuccessful clerical workers organizing campaign at New York University, beginning in the fall of 1969 and continuing through the strike of April/May 1970, the election of May 15, 1970, the New York State Labor Relations Board and the National Labor Relations Board decisions, and another election in 1971.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; New York University Clerical Workers Organizing Campaign Records; TAM 126; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
Contents of the collection include: printed ephemera produced by the organizing campaign and student supporters, statements and press releases by the university, picket duty material, and NLRB and SLRB documents.
Conditions Governing Use
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1969-1971, are expected to enter the public domain in 2091.

International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace, and Agricultural Implement Workers of America. District 65 New York University New York State Labor Relations Board United States.
